TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_TODO_00<tab>Place the polished sword before the leafman near Lyhe Ghiah.
TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_TODO_01<tab>Report to the soft-spoken Nu Mou.
TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_000<tab>Mortal, I have a task for you, should you be willing.

TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_001<tab>By the shore of the isle from which Lyhe Ghiah rises, there is a leafman. I want you to go and lay this sword before it. Do this for me, and I will give you a fitting reward.
TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_002<tab>On the isle from which Lyhe Ghiah rises, there is a leafman. Please go and place the sword before it.

TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_011<tab>Lest you wonder, that leafman was once a knight of Voeburt. A valiant soul who remained to protect the castle from sin eaters while others fled around him.

TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_012<tab>While he fought bravely, he was ultimately wounded by a creature with the touch. But ere he could turn into a monster, a pixie transformed him into a leafman.

TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_013<tab>Callous though they can be, pixies can understand the desire to protect one's home. That's why they took pity on the knight and spared him a fate worse than death.

TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_014<tab>I was there too. But frozen by fear as I was, I could do naught but watch. Ashamed, I swore to the knight that, one day, I will find a way to cure him.
TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_015<tab>Until that day comes, I look after his sword, ensuring that it's always ready for his use again.

TEXT_LUCKZD008_03415_QUIETNUMOU03415_000_016<tab>To be sure, I could have as easily taken the sword back myself, but I wanted you to know of the knight and his sacrifice. He also would've enjoyed the company of a fellow mortal, I believe.
